meanings.definition: A lively Spanish dance in triple time.
meanings.sent1: During the fiesta, Maria danced a joyful bolero with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved gracefully to the rhythm of the bolero music.
meanings.sent3: Pedro's clumsy attempt at the bolero made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The bolero of colors on the stage mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant energy of the bolero filled the room with excitement.

meanings.definition: A short, waist-length jacket worn open in the front.
meanings.sent1: She wore a stylish bolero over her dress for the evening.
meanings.sent2: The black bolero completed her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: His bright red bolero made him look like a matador.
meanings.sent4: The bolero added a touch of elegance to her ensemble.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the bolero kept her warm on the cool evening.
